document.heading: Statehood Convention Procedural Amendments Act of 1982

history.narrative: Law 4-138, the “Statehood Convention Procedural Amendments Act of 1982,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-450, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 25, 1982 and June 8, 1982, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 21, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-204 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
